intro: Dendrochilum palawanense, commonly known as the Palawan tree orchid, is an epiphytic orchid native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and possesses pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming during the rainy season. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its tropical habitat. Dendrochilum palawanense is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found growing on trees in humid, shaded environments.
